document.heading: Mental Health Services Client Enterprise Establishment Act of 1998

history.narrative: Law 12-226, the “Mental Health Services Client Enterprise Establishment Act of 1998,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 12-593, which was referred to the Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 10, 1998, and December 1, 1998, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 11, 1998, it was assigned Act No. 12-547 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 12-226 became effective on April 13, 1999.
